sentence.Network_en: We don't like strangers who poke their noses into our affairs.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们不喜欢陌生人干预我们的事务。

sentence.Network_en: John smiled at them and gave Richard a playful poke.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰冲着他们笑了笑，开玩笑地捅了理查德一下。

sentence.Network_en: He saw the dog's twitching nose poke out of the basket.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看到那只狗一抽一抽的鼻子从篮子里冒出来。

jx.jx_en_mean: look around a place, typically in search of something
To ridicule in a mischievous manner; tease.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 用恶作剧的方式来取笑；戏弄

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: origin uncertain; compare with Middle Dutch and Middle Low German poken, of unknown ultimate origin. The noun dates from the late 18th cent
Middle English: from Old Northern French poke, variant of Old French poche 'pocket'. Compare with pouch
early 18th cent.: from Algonquian poughkone (See puccoon)

encyclopedia.content: 函数名： poke 功 能： 存值到一个给定存储单元 用 法： void poke(int segment, int offset, int value); 程序例： #include <dos.h> #include <conio.h> int main(void) { clrscr(); cprintf("Make sure the scroll lock key is off and press any key\r\n"); getch(); poke(0x0000,0x0417,16); cprintf("The scroll lock is now on\r\n"); return 0; }

entry.def: If you poke someone or something, you quickly push them with your finger or with a sharp object.

example.ex: Lindy poked him in the ribs.

entry.def: If you poke one thing into another, you push the first thing into the second thing.

example.ex: He poked his finger into the hole.

entry.def: If something pokes out of or through another thing, you can see part of it appearing from behind or underneath the other thing.

example.ex: He saw the dog's twitching nose poke out of the basket...
example.tran: 他看到那只狗一抽一抽的鼻子从篮子里冒出来。

example.ex: His fingers poked through the worn tips of his gloves.
example.tran: 他的手指从手套的破指尖处露了出来。

entry.def: If you poke your head through an opening or if it pokes through an opening, you push it through, often so that you can see something more easily.

example.ex: Julie tapped on my door and poked her head in...
example.tran: 朱莉轻轻地敲了敲我的门，探进头来。

example.ex: We hadn't been able to poke our heads out and see what was going on...
example.tran: 我们无法伸出头去，看看发生了什么。

means.word_mean: 1. tall coarse perennial American herb having small white flowers followed by blackish-red berries on long drooping racemes; young fleshy stems are edible; berries and root are poisonous
2. a bag made of paper or plastic for holding customer's purchases
3. a sharp hand gesture (resembling a blow);

sentences.sentence: "he warned me with a jab with his finger"
"he made a thrusting motion with his fist"
"I gave him a clout on his nose"
"he jabbed his finger into her ribs"

means.word_mean: 2. search or inquire in a meddlesome way;

sentences.sentence: "This guy is always nosing around the office"

means.word_mean: 4. hit hard with the hand, fist, or some heavy instrument;

sentences.en: His elbow poked out through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.cn: 他的胳膊从衬衫的破袖子中露了出来。

sentences.en: He was poking at the rubbish with his stick.

jushi.english: She poked among the dish with her chopsticks unable to make up her mind to eat.
jushi.chinese: 她用筷子在那盘菜里东翻西戳,还拿不定主意要不要吃。

jushi.english: She poked a hole in the papered window to let in a streak of light.
jushi.chinese: 她在纸窗上捅了一个窟窿,让一线亮光透进来。

jushi.english: The boy is poking a frog.
jushi.chinese: 这个男孩正在拨弄青蛙。
